intro: Luzula pseudosudetica, commonly known as the Sudetic sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. This species typically grows in moist, nutrient-rich soils, often in forested or wetland habitats. Luzula pseudosudetica has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in early summer. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and small mammals.
